prompt: Generate realistic text messages that represent non-spam (ham) content. These messages should reflect a broad spectrum of everyday communication, including personal conversations, legitimate business or service notifications, casual updates, and automated alerts. Vary the tone (friendly, professional, neutral, concerned), language style (informal chats, formal announcements, concise or detailed), and topics (meeting or appointment reminders, family or friend check-ins, order or delivery confirmations, bank transaction alerts, community or event updates). Include diverse formats like quick one-word replies, detailed explanations, friendly greetings, or automated system messages (e.g., OTP codes, subscription reminders). Ensure the content simulates authentic, non-malicious communication across different contexts, relationships, and platforms, avoiding any deceptive or promotional undertones.
response:
Hey! Just checking in to see how you’re doing today.  
Don’t forget about our meeting tomorrow at 10 AM. Looking forward to it!  
Your package has been shipped and should arrive by the end of the week.  
Can you remind me to call Mom later? I keep forgetting!  
Thanks for your help with the project! I really appreciate it.  
Your bank statement is ready for review. Log in to check it out.  
Just wanted to see if you’re free for lunch this week. Let me know!  
I’ve scheduled the dentist appointment for next Tuesday at 3 PM.  
Please confirm your attendance at the community event this Saturday.  
Your verification code is 123456. Please enter it to proceed.  
Hey, I found that book you were looking for! Want to borrow it?  
The dog’s vet appointment is set for Thursday at 2 PM.  
Reminder: The deadline for the report is this Friday.  
I just got back from the trip! Can’t wait to share photos with you.  
Your subscription will renew on March 1st unless canceled.  
Can we reschedule our call to Wednesday instead?  
The kids had a great time at the birthday party! Thanks for inviting us.  
Your order has been delivered! Check your front porch.  
I’ll be late to dinner; traffic is a mess. Sorry!  
Just a heads-up: Tomorrow is the last day to submit your application.  
Hope you’re having a great day! Let’s catch up soon.  
The meeting link is in your email for tomorrow’s session.  
Your car service is due next week. Don’t forget to book an appointment!  
Hi! Just wanted to let you know I’m thinking of you.  
The event starts at 5 PM; don’t be late!  
Your feedback on the project is due by end of day. Thanks!  
I’ll pick up the groceries after work today.  
Can you send me the documents we discussed? Thanks!  
The water heater repair is scheduled for Friday morning.  
Had a great time at the concert last night! Let’s do it again.  
Your password has been successfully updated.  
I just finished the report and sent it to you for review.  
Hope the kids are doing well! Let’s plan a playdate soon.  
Your trial period ends in three days. Don’t forget to upgrade!  
Got your message! I’ll call you back as soon as I can.  
The office will be closed for Thanksgiving. Plan accordingly!  
Thanks for the reminder about the book club meeting this week!  
I just accepted your friend request on social media.  
Your appointment is confirmed for Tuesday at 1 PM.  
Looking forward to seeing you at the wedding next month!  
I’ll text you when I arrive at the restaurant.  
The laundry is done; feel free to pick it up anytime.  
Thanks for helping me with the presentation! You made it easier.  
Just checking in to see if you received my last email.  
Your feedback is important to us; please complete the survey.  
I’ve sent you the link for the online class we discussed.  
The kids’ soccer game is at 3 PM on Saturday. Hope to see you there!  
You have a payment of $50 due next week.  
Excited for our trip next month! Let’s finalize the details soon.  
The power outage has been resolved. Everything is back to normal.  
Can you confirm if you’re attending the meeting later?  
I hope you’re feeling better! Let me know if you need anything.
